isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LIFT AXLE SYSTEMS - FIXED (RIGID) AXLE ASSEMBLIES - INSTALL

svcprocinfo.para:
This section contains installation procedures for the fixed lift axle assembly and the components mounted on the lift axle assembly. Installation procedures for the control panel mounted components are located in the CONTROLS
section.

svcsubproc.title: AIR LINES - GENERAL
svcsubproc.para: Air lines can be connected to the quick-connect fittings as follows:

step1.para: Verify that the end of the line is cut clean and square.
Push the air line straight into the fitting.

svcsubproc.title: LIFT AXLE ASSEMBLY
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 14
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
Position the lift axle assembly so that the mounting holes in the lift axle side rails are aligned with the mounting holes in the vehicle frame. Clamp axle frame to frame rails to reduce movement.

note.para: When installing a lift axle assembly in the field, the original Huck fasteners are replaced with M16x60 hex flange head bolts and locknuts.
In the following two steps, install and snug-up all of the mounting hardware before tightening the hardware to the correct torque [265 - 325 N•m (195 - 240 lbf-ft)].

step1.para: Secure the lift axle front hangers to the vehicle frame using six M16x60 hex flange head, grade 10.9 bolts, and nuts for each side.
Secure the lift axle upper load bag mounts to both sides of the vehicle frame using M16x60 hex flange head, grade 10.9 bolts, and locknuts.
Remove clamps securing the axle frame to the frame rails.
Connect all supply and control air lines to the lift axle assembly .

item.para: supply line to axle mounted tank (at tank)
brake control line to axle mounted brake relay valve (at valve)
supply line from axle mounted solenoid to pressure regulator (at solenoid)
delivery/control line from pressure regulator to load bag quick release valve (at valve)

step1.para: Connect electrical connection to the lift axle solenoid.
Pressurize the air system.
Install the tires/wheels on the lift axle.

Check/perform a full alignment on the new lift axle assembly. Refer to the ADJUSTMENTS
section.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: LOAD BAG

important.para: All air bag hardware; mounting bolts, nuts, and air fittings should be torqued to 33.9 N•m (25 lbf-ft).

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 14
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.

note.para: It may be easier to install the load bag if the lift axle is raised to its normal ride height using a jack.

step1.para: Position the load bag on the bottom mounting plate with the air stem inserted into the inside hole of the top mounting plate.
Using the washer and nut, attach the bag air stem to the top mounting plate.

note.para: It may be necessary to loosen the mounting bolt securing the bag's upper mounting bracket to provide access to the upper, outside mounting bolt for the load bag.

step1.para: Secure the load bag to the outside hole of the top mounting plate with the mounting hardware previously removed.
Secure the load bag to the bottom mounting plate with the mounting hardware previously removed.
Connect the air line fitting and air line to the load bag.
Pressurize the air system.
Replace the tire/wheel if it was removed during load bag removal.
Using the axle controls, lower the axle with the replaced bag and check the load bag and the bag connection for air leaks.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: LIFT BAG/LIFT BAG QRV

important.para: All air bag hardware; mounting bolts, nuts, and air fittings should be torqued to 33.9 N•m (25 lbf-ft).

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 15
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.

note.para: If necessary, the lift axle may be raised with a jack to allow easier installation of the lift bag.

step1.para: Position the lift bag as indicated in the figure with the air stem inserted in the mounting hole of the rear mounting plate.

note.para: If necessary, lower the lift axle until the mounting hardware for the front of the lift bag can be installed.

step1.para: Using the mounting hardware removed earlier, secure the front end of the lift bag to the lift axle swing arm assembly.
Secure the lift bag air stem with a mounting nut and washer.
Verify that the air line fitting is attached to the lift bag QRV.
Install the lift bag QRV (item 3) to the bag air stem; then connect the air line to the fitting.
Install the tire/wheel if they were removed earlier for clearance.
Pressurize the air system.
Using the axle controls, set the axle with the replaced bag to its up position.
Check the lift bag and the bag connection for air leaks.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: QUICK RELEASE VALVE FOR LOAD BAGS
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 16
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
Before installing the QRV, connect the air line fittings removed from the defective QRV.
Secure the QRV (item 13) to the mounting bracket using the mounting hardware removed earlier.
Connect the air lines to the QRV.
Pressurize the air system.
Check the QRV and connections for air leaks.
Verify correct operation of the lift axle system.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: FULL FUNCTION RELAY VALVE (BRAKES)
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 16
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.

If the QRV (item 13) is currently installed, disconnect the QRV mounting bracket from the axle assembly to provide clearance. It is NOT necessary to remove the valve from the mounting bracket or to disconnect the air lines from the valve.
Connect the air line fittings to the relay valve (refer to the tags attached during removal).
Carefully thread the brake relay valve (item 12) into the correct port in the axle-mounted air tank (item 4).
Connect the air lines to the relay valve fittings.
Secure the QRV mounting bracket and valve (item 13) to the axle assembly.
Pressurize the air system.
Check the relay valve and connections for air leaks.
Verify correct operation of the lift axle brake system.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: PRESSURE PROTECTION VALVE
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 16
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
Connect air line fittings to the Pressure Protection Valve (PPV).
Carefully thread the PPV (item 15) into the correct port in the air tank (item 4).
Connect the air lines to the valve.
Pressurize the air system.
Check the PPV and connections for air leaks.
Verify correct operation of the lift axle system.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: FIVE PORT VALVE/SOLENOID
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 16
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
Connect air line fittings to the solenoid.
Position the solenoid (item 10) as indicated in the figure and secure with mounting bolts.
Connect the air lines to the solenoid.
Connect electrical connection to the solenoid.
Pressurize the air system.
Check the solenoid and connections for air leaks.
Using the axle controls, verify correct operation of the lift axle assembly.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: AXLE MOUNTED TANK
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 16
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
Connect the air line fittings and drain cock to the tank.
Carefully spread the tank mounting straps and install the tank (item 4) with the drain cock on the bottom.
Using the mounting bolts, secure the tank by clamping it into the mounting straps.
Install the PPV (item 15), with its air fittings and air lines onto the replacement tank.
Install the brake relay valve (item 12), with its fittings and air lines onto the replacement tank.
Connect the supply air line (item 3) to the tank and verify that the correct lines are connected to all tank mounted components.
Pressurize the air system.
Check all components and air line connections for leaks.
Verify correct operation of the lift axle system.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: BRAKE MECHANISM
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Group 04 BRAKES in the Master Service Manual.

svcsubproc.title: AXLE SEAT BUSHINGS
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 15 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
If necessary, use a jack to raise the axle to allow access to the cavities for the axle seat bushings.
Install four new bushings (item 4) into the swingarm.

note.para: When replacing the bushings in the field, the original Huck fasteners are replaced with 1.125 in. grade 8 bolts and locknuts.

step1.para: Position the axle so that the mounting holes in the axle seats are aligned with the holes in the new bushings. Secure the axle seats using 1.125 in. grade 8 bolts and locknuts. After ALL axle bushings have been installed, torque these connections to 1152 - 1356 N•m (850 - 1000 lbf-ft); preferred torque is 1152 N•m (850 lbf-ft).

If the arm pivot bushings have not been replaced yet, proceed to the installation procedures for the ARM PIVOT BUSHINGS. If the arm pivot bushings have been replaced, torque all bushing connections to 1152 - 1356 N•m (850 - 1000 lbf-ft); preferred torque is 1152 N•m (850 lbf-ft). Proceed to the next step.
Install the tires/wheels on the lift axle.
Pressurize the air system.
Verify correct operation of the lift axle system.
Remove wheel chocks.

Check/perform a full alignment on the lift axle assembly. Refer to the ADJUSTMENTS
section.

svcsubproc.title: ARM PIVOT BUSHINGS
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 15 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
If necessary, use a jack to raise or lower the swingarm to allow access to the cavities for the arm pivot bushings.
Install two new bushings (item 1) into the swingarm.

note.para: When replacing the bushings in the field, the original Huck fasteners are replaced with 1.125in. grade 8 bolts and locknuts.

step1.para: Place the swingarm into position and secure both swingarm pivot joints (item 1) using 1.125in. grade 8 bolts and locknuts. After ALL axle bushings have been installed, torque these connections to 1152 - 1356 N•m (850 - 1000 lbf-ft); preferred torque is 1152 N•m (850 lbf-ft).

If the axle seat bushings have not been replaced yet, proceed to the installation procedures for the AXLE SEAT BUSHINGS. If the axle seat bushings have been replaced, torque all bushing connections to 1152 - 1356 N•m (850 - 1000 lbf-ft); preferred torque is 1152 N•m (850 lbf-ft). Proceed to the next step.
Connect the front of the lift bag to the swingarm using the lift bag mounting hardware.
Install the tires/wheels on the lift axle.
Pressurize the air system.
Verify correct operation of the lift axle system.
Remove wheel chocks.

Check/perform a full alignment on the lift axle assembly. Refer to the ADJUSTMENTS
section.
